messages.message:
I m facing CI errors for my PR - https://jenkins.instabase.com/blue/organizations/jenkins/instabase/detail/PR-71092/24/pipeline/
My changes are only within IBLLM, but facing CI errors outside of IBLLM. Are these errors related to the above discussion?
I m facing this since yesterday after code cut time. I had it all passing before that and haven't changed much on the PR after that.
Facing a little different set of issues in my next run - https://jenkins.instabase.com/blue/organizations/jenkins/instabase/detail/PR-71092/26/pipeline

I was also facing above issues for my Excel detection PR:
https://jenkins.instabase.com/blue/organizations/jenkins/instabase/detail/PR-70920/8/pipeline/
cc - @Atinder
Hi @Cody Boggs, any idea on this?
:eyes:

Damn, yea this is happening elsewhere too
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C035SLYCJ9X/p1749567341964849?thread_ts=1749551816.837779&cid=C035SLYCJ9X
Wonder if we just need a new snapshot @Victor Zeng?
Or if with `uv` we might perhaps just do away with that whole thing, since it can take installs from 8-12 minutes down to 4-6 seconds. :melting_face: :rocket:
If uv can make the pip install issues go away, that would be great.

@Victor Zeng I think it's worth an experiment at some point once slow pre-merge is handled, but it'd be a bit of a wag right now (even though I'm the one who brought it up, sorry lol)

Do you know if a fresh snapshot would do the trick here? Or is this a weird poetry behavior we haven't hade to account for in the past?
Yah. A new snapshot would probably help.

Okie doke
I don't think you'll have access to do so at this point since we moved the world to core-infra, but I"ll get one kicked off shortly
TLDR; for some reason, we have the cuda version of pytroch installed.

```
[2025-06-10T13:54:29.169Z] Traceback (most recent call last):
[2025-06-10T13:54:29.169Z]   File "/root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/eecbca7b87c7c33fd2d8ffba03ee98a3/sandbox/processwrapper-sandbox/2750/execroot/__main__/bazel-out/k8-fastbuild/bin/shared-utils/py-utils/docops-lib/test/unit/py/instabase/docops_lib/docops_lib_test.runfiles/pypi_deps_torch/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 318, in _load_global_deps
[2025-06-10T13:54:29.169Z]     ctypes.CDLL(global_deps_lib_path, mode=ctypes.RTLD_GLOBAL)
[2025-06-10T13:54:29.169Z]   File "/root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/eecbca7b87c7c33fd2d8ffba03ee98a3/execroot/__main__/external/python3_9_x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/python3.9/ctypes/__init__.py", line 374, in __init__
[2025-06-10T13:54:29.169Z]     self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode)
[2025-06-10T13:54:29.169Z] OSError: libcudart.so.12: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory```

This is interesting. From the uv documentation (https://docs.astral.sh/uv/guides/integration/pytorch/#installing-pytorch):
> PyTorch would be installed from PyPI, which hosts CPU-only wheels for Windows and macOS, and GPU-accelerated wheels on Linux (targeting CUDA 12.4):
:anguished: Intereseting

That's only for poetry replacement though I think? ie: `uv add` is for uv-managed project structures, we're only doing `uv pip install -r third-party/bazel/py/requirements_py39_linux.txt` in pre-merge
These are py-utils, so it's the bazel requirements.
@Cody Boggs I've update the bazel requirements.txt file to use the cpu version of pytorch. https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/71290
Woohoo! Thanks @Victor Zeng!!
Thank You, CI passes for me now.
